Line 111: Line 111:
An opposition coalition (including presidential candidates [[Amr Moussa]] and [[Mohamed ElBaradei]], the [[New Wafd Party]], the [[Coalition of the Youth of the Revolution]], the [[National Progressive Unionist Party]], the [[el-Ghad Party]] and the [[Egyptian Arab Socialist Party]]) criticised the proposed amendments as not enough and that the new constitution needs to be written immediately to regulate the process and the requirements for [[members of parliament]]. They also said that the president's power was not limited enough under the proposed changes.<ref name="autogenerated1"/>
An opposition coalition (including presidential candidates [[Amr Moussa]] and [[Mohamed ElBaradei]], the [[New Wafd Party]], the [[Coalition of the Youth of the Revolution]], the [[National Progressive Unionist Party]], the [[el-Ghad Party]] and the [[Egyptian Arab Socialist Party]]) criticised the proposed amendments as not enough and that the new constitution needs to be written immediately to regulate the process and the requirements for [[members of parliament]]. They also said that the president's power was not limited enough under the proposed changes.<ref name="autogenerated1"/>
â
The [[Christianity in Egypt|Church]] was also opposed to the amendments.<ref>[http://www.almasryalyoum.com/en/node/354356 Source: Church rejects proposed constitutional amendments], ''[[Al-Masry Al-Youm]]''</ref> As was the reformist faction of the Muslim Brotherhood]].<Ref>[http://www.almasryalyoum.com/en/node/362657 Muslim Brotherhood reformist wing rejects constitutional amendments], ''[[Al-Masry Al-Youm]]''</ref>
+
The [[Christianity in Egypt|Church]] was also opposed to the amendments.<ref>[http://www.almasryalyoum.com/en/node/354356 Source: Church rejects proposed constitutional amendments], ''[[Al-Masry Al-Youm]]''</ref> As was the reformist faction of the Muslim Brotherhood.<Ref>[http://www.almasryalyoum.com/en/node/362657 Muslim Brotherhood reformist wing rejects constitutional amendments], ''[[Al-Masry Al-Youm]]''</ref>
